review.itemreviewed: P-6 Logo Responsibili-Tee Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody:
If you like their short-sleeve version, you’d likely also like this long-sleeve tee. The only major difference I see is the neckline - this long-sleeve has a ringer neck. The fit is great, it’s a tad slimmer of a fit than their sweatshirts. I’m usually a L but I got an XL in this so it wouldn’t be too slim-fitted. It’s also a bit longer than their short-sleeve version, which hits at the hip.

Overall I feel this shirt is soft, well-made, and will last for a while.
review.name: Nice quality long-sleeve

review.reviewBody: I live with the Atlantic up the street and brackish river and marsh/woods down the street.  Needless to say the mosquitoes are thick. You can definitely tell the difference with this hoodie, with no bug spray they don't come near me. Just ordered the pants. Hopefully with the combo I won't have to put bugspray on again
review.name: Works

review.reviewBody: As a guide in Alaska I will say this is my absolute favorite garment. Great fit and a must to repel mosquitoes.

Best shirt ever. I have 4 or 5 of them. I wear them in cold weather as a base layer, crazy hot Central Florida weather as a standalone sun shirt, wear them for golf, literally sleep in one of these every night. Most versatile, comfortable shirt ever. Now I just need a Simm X Kuiu collab to make this shirt in Verde camo. I said it first… I need a freebie when they make em. 

Perfect shirt. Hot, humid, cool, cold, everything!
review.name: Best shirt ever. Need more. Kuiu collab please, need camo…

review.reviewBody: Great top, all I wear during the summer bass  fishing..
review.name: Perfect Top

review.reviewBody: Overall works well, a few bites still through the shirt
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody: This is my go to sun hoody for my days out on the boat. Great fit, keeps the bugs off my back and holds up to high use.
review.name: If your not wearing this sunhoody your missing out

review.reviewBody: Nice lightweight hoodie. It’s my third one. I’ll always have one in my quiver.
review.name: Bug hoodie

review.reviewBody: My favorite shirt for wearing out in the Alaska summer. If mosquitos or white socks are bad, this thing saves you a lot of bites. It's not too hot to wear on a sunny day. I hate the heat. But sometimes it beats being eaten alive. It dries fast. Keeps some of the bites off. You can wet it down, and put it back on to cool off. But it still prevents bites, even in the thickest bugs.
review.name: Great sun and bug shirt

review.reviewBody: I like this model because the fabric is slightly heavier than the Solar bug stopper. I wear these when it's not mid summer hot. They really do keep the bugs at bay.
review.name: Great but slightly heavier than the solar

review.reviewBody: TESTED IN THE EVERGLADES.  A BAZILLION NO SEE UMS AND MOSQUITOES.  NO BITES!

description: Buy the Goal Zero Nomad 100 Solar Panel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nomad 100 Solar Panel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Goal Zero Nomad 100 Solar Panel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm happy to be able to pair this with my other Nomad 100
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody:
I've been using Goal Zero equipment for many years, and the equipment has always been of the highest quality & performance. However, I felt obliged to comment on the several reviews that reported lower than expected power output. There are typically two things to blame for low output: 1: Solar panel damage or geometry, 2: Battery state-of-charge, and 3: Insufficient cable size.
1. Solar panel damage and orientation... doesn't seem to be an issue with the review cases. Well documented conditions and sky exposure. Just make sure that no part of the panel is shaded of course.
2. Battery SOC : As a battery fills, especially Lithium, the charging system will taper-off to protect the battery. Battery management systems and chargers will differ slightly, but generally it will put as much current into the battery as it can until the battery is nearing 85-90% capacity. The charger will then change modes so that the charging current declines as the voltage rises through the last 10-15%. This is why you might see a battery get from 30%-80% in an hour, but then will take another hour or more to get to 95%. So, don't blame the solar panel... blame the MPPT charger and the BMS for taking care of your battery.
3. Cabling : This is something that Goal Zero should improve. If you use a 4x1 APP Combining input cable at the solar panel location, you will be trying to carry as much as 40A (200W Nomads) on a wire that is much too small. I believe the largest HPP cable is #14AWG which has an ampacity of 15A. Your energy losses in the 30' cable due to this mismatch would be over 40% in the case of 4x200W Nomads, and approx 20% if you have 4x100W Nomads, and 10% if you only have a couple of panels on the line. Better to run all the solar panels back to the Yeti and then combine. But even then, you will see 5% losses for a single 100W Nomad running over 30' on #14AWG wire (2.5% over 15'). Since Goal Zero doesn't make heavier-duty cables, if you need to go further than 15' with 100W or more of solar, you need to have cables built for you. For reference, 5% is generally the maximum acceptable loss for non-essential loads.
Hope this helps!
review.name: Great products, need larger cable options

review.reviewBody: It’s good, while hunting I would set it up in the morning facing south and get back and my Yeti 500 would be at 30% and it would charge to 90%. Even in blue sky high elevation Colorado input was in 70s add extension cord and would drop to 60s
review.name: Works pretty good

review.reviewBody: I bought a Nomad 100 and a Nomad 50 to tested the  versatility of the solar panels in comparison with the Boulder 100 and 50 Briefcase panels.  I am in Central Florida and the day of the test we have a beautiful sunny day with temperatures in the lower 70s.  Both 100 panels provided an average of 65 to 70 watts input.  When connecting the Nomad 100 and 50 using a 4 x 8 Anderson Connector the input reached and averaged of 85 watts while connecting the panels on line provided an averaged of 60 watts.  In conclusion, will be naive to believe that the advertised number for watts will produce that amount.  That number only gives you the maximum capacity/capability of the panel.  In optimal conditions you may get 75% of that capacity as an average.  I am pleased with both panels system since I use the Boulder while at home or car camping while the Nomad is better for camping and while car traveling to the beach/picnic, sport events, or fairgrounds.  Both systems can be combined with each other.
review.name: Practicality

review.reviewBody: I really wanted these panels to work. Great ideas, but when I put the panels out in direct sunlight I got no current to the charging device. Lights lit up like it was working but no juice going out of the usb plug or 8 mm plug.
review.name: Too bad it didn’t work

review.reviewBody: I have two 100W solar panels to compare, the yeti 100 watt nomad against another 100 watt no name brand and the cheaper 100 watt no name brand is pumping in 80 to 90 W into my yeti goal zero 1500 and the yeti 100 watt nomad at best pumps in 62 watts, so you get what you pay for .
review.name: Something is not right with the nomad 100s

review.reviewBody: During clear summer day, i was getting max input of 40 watts.
review.name: Low power. Not worth the money.

review.reviewBody: Purchased this unit for a Yeti 500 as the Boulder 100 Briefcase, while providing excellent power is heavy.   Today, June 7th, at 4pm US/Central in Dallas TX, on a full sun day (no clouds at all) I am getting 38W (as shown on the Yeti 500 display).  BUT,  the Boulder Briefcase 100 is providing 71W (best I've gotten from the Boulder is 91W).  Checking at different times and conditions, the Nomad seems pegged at a hair over 50% of the output of the Boulder (panels sitting side by side for the comparison).  I will probably keep the Nomad as I got it on sale, and it's still something for camping to charge phone, etc, but it doesn't not match the Boulder briefcase. I'm giving it a "Fair" rating as the price is high and the output is so low compared to the Boulder Briefcase (max 45W? compared to Boulder 100 at 90W?). The build quality is excellent, and the unit is far lighter and easier to carry than the Boulder suitcase.  I just wish Goal Zero would be upfront that the Boulder units appear to be heavier but provide a higher level of output consistently than the Nomads.  No one should have to buy 2 different units to test to figure this out. Or call this unit the "Nomad 45" and sell it for half the price.
review.name: Boulder 100 is better but heavier

review.reviewBody:
Easy to hook up straight out of the box, I will give them that. 

I am at sea level and charging a Yeti 500x on a fully sunny day in California. 100w Nomad panels, topping out at 55w (per the display on my Yeti 500x). I know, the other reviews told you and me about this already. 

I got curious, so I pulled out my multi meter. I checked the voltage (DC) at the 8mm output connection on the panels and got a reading of 20.65v, which is within the advertised range. Cool. I then checked the amperage with my multi meter set for DC and got a reading of 3.78 amps. Well you know, I am not an electrician or an electrical engineer or anything, but I am pretty sure 20.65v x 3.78 amps should equal approximately 78 watts. Seems dumb that if the panels can put out that kind of wattage, the manufacturer would want it to show up when you plug it into the “power station” of the same brand. Instead I only see 55w, which seems a bit low, even if there is some drop for the controller in the Yeti. 

Anyways, I attached pics with my multi meter display visible for reference. Just sucks for the price. But again, the other reviews told me so.
review.name: I know, the other reviews told me so

review.reviewBody: I have been using Goal Zero products for years as backup at home and for camping. Will be using this with my Yeti 400 for camping. Excellent quality and durability. Will definitely continue to use Goal Zero products in the future.
review.name: Works great!

name: Nomad 100 Solar Panel

comment: Thank you for your feedback! I’ve submitted a request to update the product description to ensure accuracy. We’ve also reached out to you directly to follow up.

review.reviewBody:
I bought blue shimano cleats on Amazon and they were counterfeit.

I returned them and bought genuine cleats from competitive cyclist at a slightly higher price and am using them now.  

I'm glad I paid the extra dollar and don't worry about fake cleats failing.
review.name: Genuine shimano cleats

review.reviewBody: This works, but after a few days use the crease from opening and refolding to pack it up create holes. I don’t know the solution. No matter the gauge, the creases create the weak points for failure. I’ve tried leaving it open when in my pack and it just bends.

review.reviewBody: If it’s needed to be explained that this short windscreen will only really help with the low profile stoves, you probably shouldn’t be handling fire anyways.

review.reviewBody: Purchased to replace the one that came with our stove. The new version is much thinner and will not last nearly as long as the original. Profit over quality, I guess.

review.reviewBody:
Two short to cover bottom of the pot
Pot sits about two inches below
review.name: Two short to cover bottom

review.reviewBody: The old style wind screen was so much better. I don’t understand the setup of this one with a huge gap where the two ends meet? That makes absolutely no sense at all.
review.name: Bring back the old style

review.reviewBody: I am not sure the heat reflector is adding some saving time..
review.name: It's handy but

review.reviewBody: This is a replacement since the original lasted and performed great. Easy to set up and effective blocks the wind. Light weight and easy to pack.
review.name: This is a replacement since

review.reviewBody: Worthless as a windscreen for pocket rocket. Why can't you have one like snow peak

description: Buy the MSR Alpinist 2 System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpinist 2 System
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpinist 2 System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this product 3 months ago and used it twice so far. It is a very compact and a light system which is what I was looking for. The quality of the pieces are well made, the cups are a good individual size than expected. I've been very impressed with the product. The handle has a little play, which concerned me initially but it doesn't seem to effect function.
review.name: Great price and a great buy

review.reviewBody: We have used out set numerous times now nd it never ceases to amaze me how light and compact it is, and how beyond packing a knife and some spoons we need nothing else on camping trips.
review.name: super light and compact

review.reviewBody: I bought it for hiking, yet I carry it on my motorcycle and it can hold the ride and all the bumps of the trip without been harmed. Easy to carry, compact and works great on the stove.
review.name: Light and strong!

review.reviewBody: Brilliant product, filled with great features and really nice attention to detail
review.name: Just about everything you need!

review.reviewBody: 11 years ago I acquired a WhisperLite and brought it in a month trip to Patagonia. I also brought a small old pot that I'd been using for several years with butane stoves. The result is a hole in the bottom of the pot after a week. I used silver tape to fix it. It was fun but I decided I need a good pot for the next time, my choice was MSR Alpinist 2 because I thought it was a good idea to have a complete system with everything I would need. It's light and compact and you can store complementary cooking itens inside it.
review.name: a reliable system

review.reviewBody: I bought this a long time ago and I use it intensively and it's still awesome.
review.name: Full complete

review.reviewBody: I bought this set for when I backpack with my son. We love it, its big enough to cook a meal for both of us and compact enough to not take up a ton of room. They clean up really easy also.
review.name: Compact

review.reviewBody: MSR Alpinist 2 has made a awesome replacement for my prior MSR Blacklight set. I have used it 6-8 times now and it makes for such a convenient kit. Coffee for two or soup cups, high rimmed plates for easy around the campfire meals, and easy clean-up with the non-stick finish. The cups keep beverages hot and insulate even better when the lids are snapped on. The measurement markings are easy to read when you need just the right amount of fluids for cooking. The new handle attachments are great for keeping things locked down during storage and give you a little more to grab then the clamp style previously used. Lids have built in strainer and with my XGK stove I can boil water pretty darn quick. I will always use MSR for my Camp Kitchen needs. Thanks.
review.name: Awesome 2 person Kit

review.reviewBody: I love our pots and insulated cups from MSR. Lightweight, compact and perfect for your next outdoor adventure.
review.name: Great two person pot system.

review.reviewBody: Picked this up cooking kit up prior to last season and got to take it out on several trips, including a couple of multi-day backpacking trips, a canoe overnight and some car camping. It has held up great. The ability to collapse the mugs and pans together helps maximize space, but it also allows you to leave behind whatever you don't need for a specific trip. If you ditch one of the mugs it will usually fit a Pocket Rocket stove and a small gas canister inside the pot with room for a few more small items. Haven't had any problems with heat distortion, scratches or dents. Everything has held up great.
review.name: Light and versatile

name: Alpinist 2 System

description: Buy the DAKINE Drafter 14L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Drafter 14L Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Drafter 14L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My old camelback was falling apart so I upgraded to this.

Pros - I love how low profile it it while still having a lot of breathability on my back. There's tons of room and pockets for snacks, glasses and tools. Some of those internal pockets are real tight if you have normal sized hands. I can fit my chin bar and pads in the outside pocket on the way up and the clips make it easy to keep it in place. The pack straps down real nice and snug and doesn't bounce all over the place.

Cons - I don't know what cracked out person designed the bladder system, but its pretty derp. To their credit, you have the option to open from the top or bottom to access the bladder, however, neither make it remotely easy to get it back in place. Rather than the tried and true tall thin bladder shape, they opted for thiccc n short. It's still somehow 3l, but I do not know how...So assuming you've filled the bladder and put it back in, to keep it in place theres a weird button/hook type thing you need to have x-ray vision to actually clip in place. All in all, none of these things really matter in performance, but in practice its annoying to deal with.

If I could give half stars I'd go with 4.5/5
review.name: Great pack, meh water system

name: Drafter 14L Hydration Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Guardian Filter Cartridge Replacement online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have been using this filter for years in far flung places and was super happy with its performance. Then it started leaking water from the side through the crack where the filter element screws into the unit. So instead of getting filtered water through the bottom hole, water squirts out through the sides. No matter who tightly I screw in the filter element, it keeps squirting out the side. Will the purchase of a new filter cartridge solve this problem?
review.name: I was happy with this filter until it started leaking at the bottom

review.reviewBody:
MSR Guardian. 
I bought it two days ago as a present for my wife for her birthday to use it in her upcoming trip to Nepal. 
When I tested it, it start leaking. I tried to disassembled it by hand to find out that the end nut was broken.
Very disappointing 
I'm wondering about those military standards...or it is just a trick to by very expensive and not reliable kit.
I will ask the shop for return but doubt I will buy again this purifier.
review.name: Nik

review.reviewBody: This is my third replacement filter for my Guardian filter. I have not used this one yet but my guardian has lived up to my expectations. I use it for filling 5 gallon plastic Jerry cans. The speed of filling is great. We've filled from lake Michigan and several creeks and small ponds in mid to northern Wisconsin. My first filter I changed because I took water from the Displanes River just across the southern boarder into Illinois's. Out of pure paranoia from chemicals in this water we did not drink. We thru away the cans we filled and the filter element from the Guardian. I truly wish this system could incorporate a chemical and heavy metals filter of some sort. Otherwise... This is a good system for us.
review.name: This is my third replacement

review.reviewBody: Backpacking and international travel. This thing cannot be beat.
review.name: Expensive but worth it.

name: Guardian Filter Cartridge Replacement

review.reviewBody:
They are cozy, comfortable and look great. They keep me warm in most temps. The back side is thin so there is a noticeable breeze when it’s super cold out. 
I bought 2, one in medium and one in small. The small fit snug but not tight. I’m 5’2” and 128 lbs. Length is good.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: I really love these pants, as they're super warm a cozy! I do wish they had down on the back side to maximize warmth, but overall they're great. Also, they run on the shorter side, and my ankles are exposed unless I wear a longer sock with them. I did like them enough to purchase them in a second color.
review.name: Warm, but short inseam!

review.reviewBody: So perfect. Keep you warm while making your body look amazing. Not bulky or stiff. I wear them around the house sometimes when it’s cold I love them so much. 5’9 120 lbs and I bought a small. Perfect fit
review.name: Stansbury ALLIED down tight

review.reviewBody: I recently received this item.  I got it for my wife as a birthday present. She LOVES IT!!  She gets cold in the winter and will wear this like a uniform. My daughter in law suggested it as she loves her pants that she bought from you just like these.
review.name: Warm and cozy

review.reviewBody: When I got these pants, I was surprised to see that they did not have the down insulation on the back of the legs. I was looking for more warmth, so these pants were not what I wanted, but they will work fine for my daughter who is not as cold sensitive as I am.
review.name: great price

review.reviewBody: The stitching is coming apart in one spot. It's not too noticeable and I can sew it back up, but it did come undone.
review.name: Great except the stitching is coming apa

review.reviewBody: Wore this during my recent trip to Canada and I'm very happy with these pants. For reference,  I'm under 5 ft tall and the length was perfect. I usually have a hard time to find pants that have the right length. The pants kept me warm on a 32 degree day. I think it would've been better if the back part is also quilted. Overall, these pants are great
review.name: Perfect fit for a petite girl

review.reviewBody: I like the front of the pants but not the back. The back is just regular material. I wanted the warm material in the back as well. It doesn’t keep my bum warm.
review.name: It is comfortable

review.reviewBody: I love these pants! I was nervous to buy due to some for the reviews indicating that they ran short. I am almost 5’10” and they hit right at my ankle. I wear them with boots and they are perfectly fine. For reference, I usually wear a women’s 6-8 and I got the medium. I have worn them several times and they are super warm and comfortable.
review.name: Great Insulated Pants!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a trip to Tromso, Norway and they were perfect for the cold weather. Very comfortable and have give to them for sitting and bending. Easy to tuck into snow boots for out and about. Sized up to wear over layers. Highly recommend!
review.name: Comfy & Warm

review.reviewBody: I never used this because I bolted it in place and it was too soft to hold any amount of pressure
review.name: nice size, floppy

review.reviewBody:
Overall, really happy with my purchase. I don't mind a slightly larger frame bag to carry essentials. What I am happy about:
+ Durable, stealthy design bag. Made of a matte material.
+ Bolt-on lessens the wear on the frame paint from straps. And looks cleaner!
+ Large usable space, able to fit: wallet, keys, phone, hand pump, 1x tube, cereal bar, and other tiny objects.
+ Elastic strap design and adjustability that wraps around the step.
+ Lifetime warranty

Things to note:
- Mounting bolts not included. My frame did not come with them either.
- If aesthetics matter to you, the bottom of the bag is flat. If your top tube is angled/curved the end will be "raised" (see photo). Doesn't bother me.
- Leg may brush on the bag when climbing out of the saddle. Otherwise not obstructive in any other way.
review.name: Stealthy, Durable Bolt-On Top Tube Bag

name: Bolt-On Toptube Bag

review.reviewBody: Works great.  Like most Thule products the instructions are at best vague. Plan on redoing it at least once.  The biggest challenge is the integration with the Caprock.  When you put a Caprock over the back you take off the cross bars.  So now you have two crossbars with no known future to store or throw away (bleh).  I would also note that another three inches in height would make the product much more versatile, as others have noted.  All-in-all though a great product!
review.name: Excellent Product -- Integration Challenge

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using the Thule Xsporter Pro Mid for a couple of months now. It was super easy to install on my 2018 Honda Ridgeline even though they mention it doesn’t fit. I saw this on a Honda ridgeline at overland Expo. It holds my 2 person roof top tent with ease and I cannot wait to get a few more items on it as well
review.name: Honda Ridgeline Fit

review.reviewBody: This was an easy install and the build quality is super solid. We got this for our rooftop tent but it will work for many other applications. Impressed.
review.name: Quality build

review.reviewBody: Just received this rack in great condition. Only negative comment I would like to make is that the instructions were horrible . No verbiage at all , just pictures. All the parts on the product sheet were labeled A-Z but no piece itself was labeled. Besides that and it taking some time to set up it fits well with my Thule Tepui Roof Rack
review.name: Great rack!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for our Ford Ranger to carry kayaks. With the j channel kayak mounts this is the perfect height. We are very pleased with it.
review.name: Perfect fit

name: Xsporter Pro Mid

description: Buy the Klymit Klymaloft Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Klymaloft Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Klymaloft Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good support, no pain when waking up. Takes a lot of air to inflate.must use an inflator.
review.name: Great pads

review.reviewBody: Could be easier to inflate but otherwise more than solid
Lightweight and compact.  Easy to inflate.  I used if for a week of Elk hunting with temperatures in the 20s.  I was perfect and kept me warm
review.name: Great Sleeping pad

review.reviewBody:
I've used this for car camping on a bike trip and for that use case I think it's great. I've spent a good deal of time sleeping on the ground as a wildland firefighter and I think this is probably the most comfortable pad I've slept on with the memory foam. it's a quiet pad as well which is really nice for a double pad. Everything is a give and take though and the downsides are this is a strictly car camping pad as it's enormous, don't buy this with any expectations of packing it around. It also takes quite a bit of effort to inflate, a pump sack would be a pretty nice addition here as it's a double. I've never minded inflating pads in the past but after a few days I started thinking about a small electric pump.
Great pad overall as long as it's used in it's tinted role, car camping luxury.
review.name: great car camping pad

review.reviewBody: Most sleeping pads that I have used in the past did not work out so well for me. This double sleeping pad was great out of the box. Took it out camping for a few days and slept great. It was very comfortable and slept through the night. Highly recommend it to others.

This is a great product easy to pack up and set up! Great for a rooftop tent and traveling when you need an air mattress but have limited space. I wish there was just a bit more memory foam then there is.
Used in fly in basecamp and slept very well - comfortable and as an unexpected benefit less likely to slide off given the covering on the pad.
It's so comfy and had enough insulation to keepi warm from cold ground.
review.name: Best sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and  packs up into a small bag.  Great for cots or on the ground. Very durable.  The only blemish on the product is that the inflation valve cover is hard to snap close and if it not closed completely it will leak air.

This is by far the most comfortable camping mattress I have ever owned. It is better than the mattress on my bed. The only downside is you better have an electric pump or you will be inflating this thing for days. It is too large and heavy for backpacking (the Static V is much better for that) but it is the most comfortable mattress you could ever want for car camping.
review.name: Unbelievably Comfortable

name: Klymaloft Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: I really like these boots – as many others have stated, these run wider than the normal deck boots but are also more cushioned and stable because of the thicker outsole. I’ve had my pair for about two years, use them for yard chores, working outside, mud/snow, etc. I like the original deck boots for wearing on the boat since they’re lighter and less clunky. Still, I find these much more comfortable, wear them almost daily and would highly recommend them!
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: I never buy any other boots extra tuff Ben on my feet for 10 + years I probably  have 30 pairs  but the last 4 years the boots have become  cheap  pieces  of S@%T at the same time I bought a pair  of Grundens Deviation 6 inch Ankle Boot  they suck too there uncomfortable  to wear all  day on deck  but they held up better the my favorite  boot the extras the bottom  is separated  like  my third marriage  the souls are as wore  as mine  and the knob u use to take the boot off fell off I wish they would  get  there S%^T together  over there at extra tuff   so I don't gonna find a new boot company  to buy my boots from  and once fisherman  start talking  on the dock it's ova for a company  I don't want that to happen soooo please fix this put money  back in to the company  to make it better  then putting  bonuses  and raising  the ceos salary  or u won't have a company  us fisherman  are a fickle bunch no one buys anything  unless  another fisherman  has had them and has wore them and got at least 2 years outta them  mine fell apart in 6 days  so In closing  I love u guys but fix the problem  or u will be closing
review.name: These boots fell apart  like my 3rd marriage

review.reviewBody: Runs larger than regular deck boot.They are also a lot heavier.
review.name: Runs wide and large

review.reviewBody: These suck. Not in a good way. They lasted less than 2 weeks walking around town. Forget about wearing them in an actual wheelhouse. Seems like Xtratuf isnt making gear for actual fishing or actual work anymore. the last for xtratuf boots Ive bought Ive been disappointed with. I guess theyre keeping the caulking industry alive. 3M giving you guys any kickbacks?
review.name: Big price, little value
comment:
RealFisherman365,
Sorry to hear about your experience with the boots you received and them not holding up as we would expect them to.  Please reach out to our support team so we can make sure this gets resolved asap. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: They're great for the first couple of months, but after that expect them to fall apart. I wear them casually, definitely not commercially and they can't even hold up to that. I contacted xtratuf and they told me to return them to the retailer I purchased them from, which even though outside of their policy window they honored... three times.  I've gotten a max of 6 months before they fall apart/leak, and I'm finally done taking the time to exchange them. I'll go with another brand that believes in building a quality product instead of these.
review.name: Save your time and money
comment:
Hello,
We are sincerely sorry your boots are not holding up as we would expect them to.  If you need any additional assistance please do not hesitate to reach out to our support team: xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com
We appreciate your support!

review.reviewBody: Great looking boots but they perform terribly. Slips a lot and the worst part is that they DO NOT KEEP ANY WATER OUT. Wet feet after every shift. Also second pair with the same issues.
review.name: They let water in
comment:
Gimo,
It sounds like you may have received a defective pair of boots.  Please reach out so that we can take care of this issue right away.  We appreciate your support! xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: I’m a fan of XTRATUF, this particular Camo boot needs a 1/2 size. 12’s were to lose & 11’s were to small. Now I have 2 pairs that don’t fit.
review.name: Great boot, bad sizing

review.reviewBody: I work as a plumber and split days between this pair and another pair of boots from a different company. Even giving this pair a day per week advantage of 3 days a week, times 10 weeks... that's only 30 wears. I'm pretty disappointed in this boot. I wouldn't expect to see the sole disconnecting like is after such a short period of time.
review.name: Sole disconnected after 30 wears
comment:
Hello Plumber,
Sorry to hear you are not satisfied with your new boots.  We do offer a 1 year limited warranty.  Please reach out if you need any assistance.  We appreciate your support.
xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: Runs way big.. probably a full size larger than my other xtratuf’s
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: Not too bad just disappointed in the glue that holds the rubber and neoprene together as in a month and a half of moderate use it has already started coming apart which doesn’t make the boots unusable just not what I would like to see
review.name: Overall pretty decent

name: Wheelhouse Ankle 6in Deck Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable casual sneakers. I bought them and took them on a two week trip to Asia. Unfortunately they are already coming apart near the lacing. I always take care to unlace my shoes when I take them off, so I was surprised they started coming apart so soon. I expected better quality for the price, and it’s too bad because I love them otherwise!
review.name: Comfortable but not durable

review.reviewBody: As a nurse I spend 12+ hours in these shoes, many of them standing. I put in about 8-10k steps and 30-40 stair flights a day and these are by far the most comfortable, rugged, and stylish shoe I have ever had. They hold up very well to the stress I put on them. I feel so grateful I got these.
review.name: Amazing quality and comfort

review.reviewBody: I really enjoy the Terrawave Sneaker for everything I do. I walk our golden retriever twice daily and I do all my daily stuff with them. The Sneakers are comfortable and have just the right support for me without being over the top.
review.name: I will buy Terrawave Sneakers again. I love them.

review.reviewBody: I just bought a pair this evening and they were the most supportive and comfortable show I've ever purchased. I had tried on three others pairs of shoes before trying Terrawave sneaker and as soon as I put these ones on I knew they were the ones!
review.name: Absolute comfort

review.reviewBody: These sneakers were so comfortable the moment I put them on.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable shoe and excellent for walking.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: Wanted to get these to wear while I do photoshoots, and they're comfy! Was expecting a neutral beige color shoes but they're gray/purple.
review.name: Comfy, but "Blanc" is more Gray!

review.reviewBody: When I initially got these, I was not the biggest fan. They are a bit bulky looking. I guess that's the style now. After wearing them a few times, I can say that they are very comfortable. I haven't worn them out hiking or in wet conditions yet so I'm not sure if they are in fact water resistant or waterproof.
review.name: So far they are good

review.reviewBody: these shoes literally just arrived at my door, and they fit great! i got these basically free from a code teva donated to a lgbtq youth organization. the shoes are great and they support great causes.
review.name: amazing!

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe a week before a trip to Europe, I wore them everyday and walked for miles without any breaking in discomfort. These shoes were comfortable from the first time I put them on, I highly recommend for walking and light hikes.
review.name: Best walking shoe

name: Terrawave Sneaker - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond FirstLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FirstLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond FirstLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: If I'm not on a bike tour somewhere in the world, I am more than likely at my home in Nepal or Colorado. I am always on the lookout for a lightweight well-made, high quality, self-standing and weather proof tent. Yes, I use this while on my bike and when away from home in either the U. S. or Nepal, I find it extremely useful to have this tent sitting in the bottom of my pack ready-to-use at a moment's notice. When I let people know that I don't need my own room, I'm suddenly an invited guest! I am a huge supporter of Bibler/Black Diamond tents and have used several models extensively around the world for decades.
review.name: From Bike Touring to Living in Nepal

review.reviewBody: I'm pretty much just a weekend warrior and go car camping. I used it when the weather dropped around 50°f and was pretty comfortable. The only issue I have is I wish it was an inch longer or I could stake out the back of the tent and pull it back some my. I'm 6ft 1 and I have no extra room between my head and the tent.
review.name: Great for car camping

review.reviewBody: Great tent, set up is pretty easy once you get the hang of it. Extra canvas in the corners are great for preventing tent poles from punching through. I would definitely recommend it.
review.name: Fills all of my needs

review.reviewBody:
I attempted a Mt. Baker/Kulshan summit on 6/26. It started raining when we got back to Hog's Back (basecamp) at around 11am. By 11:30, the tent had started leaking from the seams/poles (since they're on the inside). Water was dripping down on my face while I was napping, which is why I noticed. The rain stopped at around 1/1:30pm, but started back up at around 5. It rained from 5pm, through the night, and into the next morning. When I woke up at 7am, everything in my tent was wet. I mean everything. My backpack, my sleeping bag, my shoes... It was all soaked through. There were multiple puddles on the ground of the tent. I luckily had a dry bag with a few items of clothing and my big puffer, so I could put some dry layers on before heading back to our cars that morning. I would not have been able to stay another day on the mountain in the condition that the tent and my personal items were in.

Another individual in our group had the same tent and experienced the same issues (not waterproof, woke up next to puddles and wet personal items), so this is clearly not an isolated experience or a single, defective tent that was sold to me. 

How can Black Diamond, in good conscience, say that this is a four season tent? It's not at all. Please do better. Seal the seams on this tent before selling it to people who are planning on using it in potentially extreme weather conditions.
review.name: NOT WATERPROOF AT ALL.

review.reviewBody: The lightest option for alpine mountaineering. Thank you BD for taking our adventures further.
review.name: bombproof Tent!

review.reviewBody: this is still the gold standard bivy tent for climbers - light, weatherproof enough for most of the times you are actually out trying to climb something, and cheap enough to thrash. super quick and easy to pop once you do it a couple times. of course if you're over 6, then you're definitely touching foot and head unless you can sleep diagonally - which is a palace for one. BD - make a firstlight with longer dimensions please.
review.name: the industry standard

review.reviewBody: Have a first light that is now about 10 years old. The poles have finally lost their elasticity but it’s a decade old. Have used in temps down to 30. Never leaks. Does get a little condensation when 2 are using it. By myself it does better. It’s a tight squeeze for 2 people but it keeps it light and simple. I can pitch this tent in about 5 mins and pack it away just as fast. You won’t regret spending the money on this one.
review.name: Great tent

review.reviewBody: In cold climates, you wake up with an incredible amount of water inside your tent, in snowy climates, that water turns into ice, and you literally have a blanket of ice on top of you at dawn.
review.name: The worst tent

review.reviewBody:
TMDL; Great tent for ANTS!

This tent is a really great approach to a singlewall, four season and alpine tent. I bought the 2-person for use in fast and lightweight travel in snowy terrain. Since having the previous generation since 2014, I have 9 years with this tent and can give some perspective as 6'3" tall human. 
When I first got the tent, I was excited at the small format and light weight. The engineering is brilliant. The poles go up easily from the inside and stay in place with the velcro loops. Ventilation is good and works pretty well for such a small tent. The floor of the tent holds up well to dog claws and I haven't seen more than one small puncture in a decade.
The challenge for this tent is the small length. Anyone 6 feet tall or more will likely barely fit this 84" at the floor tent. Since the walls are not vertical, they are probably closer to 80-81" long at the forehead when on a foam+inflatable mattress set up in extreme cold. You might be thinking, for someone 6' tall, that is still 8 inches, but even then, the loft off your bag and pillow at toe and head will certainly be in contact with the tent wall. In my 2-wall winter tent, this would not be an issue. In this tent, condensation is raining down the sides through the night if you add a dog or second human. The vents and vapor barrier wall cannot keep up in very cold temps. Anything on the floor should likely be in a water proof container so the moisture doesn't impact it. You may feel a little colder than usual if the humidity peaks in the tent.

All in all, I am happy at the diagonal when using this 2-person tent alone. I am 6'3" and can get a pretty comfortable humidity and not have my head and toe touch the tent walls. Fortunately, my wife (5'3") has demanded we keep this tent for her to use in the case that we ever get a divorce.
review.name: Bad tent for tall people

review.reviewBody: Worked great throughout our hike on the Enchantments

name: FirstLight Tent: 2-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had this helmet for almost 3 months, and I’m a rider that is on the bike 6-8 hours per week. It’s mostly on the road, but I’m happy if I can find some good gravel bike friendly dirt. What I like about It is that it looks like a “normal” helmet, and doesn’t get too crazy with optimizing for aerodynamics. My head stays cool on warmer days. And I really appreciate the holder for my sunglasses. The newer MIPS protection, where the shell has more freedom to move, is a nice update, and I think makes for improved safety. BUT… the one thing I haven’t been happy about is that with the improved freedom to move, you hear the MIPS pieces rubbing against each other a fair bit since it’s all happening inches from your ears. I think I’ve finally been able to tune out that sound, but it’s taken me some time.

TLDR; If you’re looking for a non-aero helmet without good coverage, keeps you cool, lets you easily stash your glasses, and has some improved safety tech. This is a good choice. But if you really don’t like to be distracted by the sound of the MIPS components rubbing against each other, you may want to look elsewhere.
review.name: It Checks the Boxes, But…

name: Search Bike Helmet

review.reviewBody: I fill this up to 110 psi on a 19mm inner width rim with a wheel-on, heavy flywheel trainer, and if I wipe it down with alcohol before every use, I get 4000-5000 miles out of them. No slippage. Doesn't overheat.
review.name: Best trainer tire

review.reviewBody: Good tire - long lasting and quiet.  Shipped quickly.
review.name: Good tire - long lasting and quiet

review.reviewBody: Blowout Less than two months old! About 900 miles on Zwift!
review.name: Blowout

review.reviewBody: catastrophic blow out with less than 200 miles of zwifting!! No warning, just a HUGE BANG!
review.name: Blow out less than 200 miles!

review.reviewBody: After wearing out several expensive road tires, I decided to jump in a get the trainer tire. I put it on a spare wheel w/o a PowerTab tub for use with a PowerBeam Pro trainer. I do have to go through the very slight trouble to change out the back wheel on my bike when I put it on the trainer, but it's not a big deal or any hassle at all. The trainer tire is quiet and very durable. After countless hours using it over the long Alaska winter when road bikes are essentially useless outside, I see no wear at all. I expect at least another 3 year of use from this tire before I'll even have to consider getting a new one.
review.name: Awesome tire for the trainer, saves my expensive road tires

name: Trainer Tire

description: Buy the Lezyne Pressure Over Drive Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pressure Over Drive Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Pressure Over Drive Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Works well enough to seat tubeless 29x3.0 tires. The chuck design is a real pain to use though. The presta/shrader flip flop head is threaded in the same direction as threading the chuck into your valve. So it’s easy to unscrew one when you try to unscrew the other. Why not just use a levered chuck? Also the hose keeper at the base of the pump is basically useless for holding the hose in place for storage. 3 stars because it seats the tires well enough.
review.name: Seats tires, but the chuck sucks

review.reviewBody: A good looking pump but it fails to do its main purpose.  Even after being pumped to 200psi, this wasn't able to seat an XC tire.  It simply cannot release enough air, fast enough to seat a tire.
review.name: Not quite strong enough to seat tires

review.reviewBody: The concept is a good one, and I am sure if I was constantly mounting tubeless tires, this would be a good option.  But, for a rider like me that mounts tires once or twice a year, this is way over priced and not worth the investment.  Granted, there are some crappy tubeless tires on the market that are just beasts to mount, and in those cases, this would help.  Otherwise, save your money.
review.name: It's a pump...still overpriced

name: Pressure Over Drive Floor Pump

Highly recommend these boots for hiking!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus WP Amped Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased these boots over 3 years ago and have over 300 miles on them. They are now starting to let me know it’s time for a New pair. These have been my most sturdy, most comfortable and reliable hiking boots I have ever had. I have 4 diff hiking boot brands from ASICS, Salmon and KEENs and I choose my Columbias every time when I am doing a more challenging hike esp when I need ankle stability and support. You will not go wrong with these boots, from a beginner to more of an experienced hiker. Plus when they said they’re waterproof they are! Without being too hot even when wearing hiking socks! I would know living in the Pacific Northwest ( PCW).  You will not be disappointed with this purchase!
review.name: Great reliable and comfortable boot

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus WP Amped Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these boots back in October. I  never been happier with a pair of boots/shoes ever! They are true to size, very comfortable, supportive, very waterproof and breathable! I have multiple foot issues and these here boots have helped me a lot! I highly recommend these for anyone and plan to buy a couple more pairs when the opportunity arises!
review.name: Best Boots ever!

name: Newton Ridge Plus WP Amped Wide Hiking Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Savu 5L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Savu 5L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Savu 5L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had the Savu 5 for about 2 years of riding 3 times a week. I never ride without it! Material is durable and the zippers still work like new. There is enough storage for a mid ride PB&J along with a spare tube, plugs, tool kit and small pump. All you need to go for a ride and come back from the ride. I would buy another but just don’t need to yet. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Savu 5

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have not had the chance to use the pack yet. I have had the time to try it on and get comfortable with it. Has lots of room for miscellaneous small tools, snacks phone. The bottle holders work and fit my 2 bottles well. Have to give high marks for the added back support, very comfortable. Quality of the pack is really nice. I plan to use it for many years to come.
review.name: Have not had the chance

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great size hip bag. Storage lockets are easy to access and well thought out. Easy to use and comfortable.
review.name: Great size hip bag. Storage

review.reviewBody: Has nice little pockets inside mid compartment for tools, two side compartments, and the long compartment next to the back is perfect size for my iPhone.
review.name: Convenient storage

review.reviewBody: Great little pack so far. I purchased this little hip pack for bikepacking, and it’s just what I needed. I don’t like leaving valuables, such as money, wallet, ID, and a few other smaller things on the bike, so this allows me to carry those things on my person without adding too much weight to the saddle. The other feature I really like is the option to carry two extra water bottles when necessary and I found those also work well to carry a tool kit or my MSR fuel bottle. The zippers work well, the bright blue color makes it easy to find in the dark, and it stays put on my hips. I would buy this again.
review.name: Savu blue!

name: Savu 5L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody:
I purchased through a camping outlet here in Australia, Only use it for night time urinal.
We have had it for just over 12 months, on a recent weekend camping trip it began leaking from the flush tank, an inspection found that there was a joint between moldings that was weeping, and an even closer inspection I found 2 hair line cracks in the middle of a flat area of the underside. 
I had no option but to use my soldering iron to melt these areas to stop it leaking.
review.name: Good toilet, But

review.reviewBody: My Portable broke first time using. The flange in the black tank portion slid off of tracks and wont return rendering the bottom pretty unsanitary for moving around. BUT called Dometic about the issue and no questions asked replaced the unit. Offered to send pictures and of obviously cant sent back. Nope didnt need it! They sent it out! Thanks Dometic for the CS!!
review.name: Broke but…..

name: 2.6 Gallon 972 Portable Toilet

review.reviewBody: I love this shoe. zero drop allows for great knee alignment, and extension. it reduces stresses on the knee. I have the best balance, stride, and foot strike with this shoe. I am mostly a trail walker not a runner
review.name: I love this shoe, its my fav hiker,

review.reviewBody: Transitioning to zero-drop. I've put 20 miles on. Still figuring things out, but they aren't comfortable yet. They seem to be made with cheap materials but seem sturdy enough. The jury is out
review.name: The Jury is Out

review.reviewBody: I have not bought the superior model since 2018, been running in lone peaks. I started working on using less and less padding again and made the switch back to the superiors to find them narrow in the toe box. Not painfully so, but they seem like the fabric is going to wear out from being pulled tight. I like the rest of the shoe, drys fast, fits properly in the heel, tread had a good amount of grip. I would recommend to anyone with regular width feet; if the fabric holds up I will buy again.
review.name: Been a while since I bought the Superior

review.reviewBody: I have wide flat feet and these are the most comfortable uppers I've ever owned! However,... the soles make them very one dimensional for me. I've gone through four pairs and love them all WHEN IT IS DRY OUT! These shoes are awful on any type of wet terrain. I came to Altra from a decade of INOV8's and the two could not be more different. I am used to THE BEST traction in any condition on any surface with INOV8's and the Altra is the worst I have experienced. Customers have complained for years about this same problem yet Altra does nothing to improve them. I don't get it. Buy this shoe if you know you can count on dry trails and you won't be disappointed. Just know that if it's wet out these are a liability.
review.name: One thumb up!... the other down.

review.reviewBody: Wear these for work and pleasure they're holding up well very roomy and really comfortable I'm a heavy person the superior 6 is withstanding the pressure
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I used to be able to run Superior sockless out of the box. I ran a 50k sockless in an early version with no blisters. The 5's were the first version to give me a blister at first, but we broke each other in. The 6's have been been giving me blisters in several spots with no end in sight. Notably narrow in the forefoot, blisters on lateral side of foot. Top out eyelet corner cuts into ankle. Sad.
review.name: Bummed re: the decline of my favorite shoe

review.reviewBody: they need to be wide again. you guys really nailed it with the 5.0 and i'd love to see that in the next version. even though the durability probably improved with the new upper material, the 'sock with a sole' feel from the 5's was killer. i've been running and backpacking in superiors since the 2.5 and the 5's and 6's have been the best so far. again, they need to be wider. the 6 is visibly narrower than the 5 or any other i've worn. also, for anyone out there saying they aren't durable enough: i've put 800-1000mi on every pair of superiors i've had at ultra-distance days. so please, the 5's, do that again. the superior is the best shoe in the world.
review.name: still love the superiors, but

review.reviewBody: Those criticizing these shoes know nothing about good running shoes. These have great support. Never stop making these. Thick outsoles on running shoes SUCK. These are perfect for your feet.
review.name: Love these shoes.

review.reviewBody: Even with the laces all the way loose, it's really tight across the mid and forefoot, which is disappointing. Might break in to fit, but that's not usually what I expect from Altra. My last four pairs of a variety of models all fit like a dream right out of the box. The toe-box itself is Altra-standard, but if your mid-foot is all crammed together, I can see why other reviewers found it too tight in one way or another. I didn't read the reviews--after so many pairs of Altras, I kind of assumed it'd be fine. Cosmetically, the pull loop on the heel sticks out enough I could fit three fingers into it. I'm going to just cut it off, as I don't need that dangling around back there. Definitely trying to solve a problem no one actually has... Really a weird shoe, despite looking like the most straight up the middle walking shoe in the catalog. Just... doesn't seem Altra-ish at all. Frustrating.
review.name: Strangely tight across the midfoot, and pull loop is goofy.

review.reviewBody: I've purchased these shoes in hopes for training and hiking. These shoes were really uncomfortable in the arch, no ankle support, and cheap quality. Really disappointed in those brand.
review.name: First and Last Altra purchase

name: Superior 6 Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Feels fantastic underfoot on both road and single track trail. I had to go a full size down compared to what I wear in the SL 2.
review.name: Loved it once I got the right size-full size down

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great trail shoes. Very comfortable and looks smart
review.name: Best

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and lightweight but limited colour in orange
review.name: Comfortable and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Pretty good, but there are many shoes everywhere..
review.name: Mid

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like them a lot but the upper is quite thin around the sides of the ankle. On a recent race I was running around the side of a hill and the angle my foot was at meant the upper rubbed a lot of skin below the ankle bone . Just something to be aware of - I tape that area of my foot now as a precaution
review.name: Great shoes but one issue….

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: good trail running shoe,  only downside is can get dirty
review.name: good trail running shoe

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super shoe and very aggressive push on the front. Very fun.
review.name: Best around

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] For the first two kilometres my right Achilles tendon didn't seem to like the shoes, but that was temporary. Comfortable, lightweight shoes with enough cushioning for long runs. I did a 30 km run in them in dirt and snow, and the shoes had nice grip on icy patches.
review.name: Good for long runs

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve had these shoes for a month now and am very disappointed in them. They have given me blisters on my toes, my heels, and even the bottom of both forefeet. I expected far more from these shoes. Even the carbon plate in them is extremely weak. I would never go with these shoes again. They are decent in terms of traction but that’s about it.
review.name: Foot blisters galore

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfy trail shoes. Glad I got them especially in the sale ! Can’t go wrong
review.name: Highly recommend

name: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits well, very flattering and stays in place during water activities!
review.name: Fits well, very flattering and

review.reviewBody: This bottom piece is super cute in the images online. Trying it on in person, they looked a bit different. The cut was much higher than the images showed. The front comes up a bit too high, in the groin area, for my comfort. The print is so cute! I did purchase several other pieces in the print. I’m sure this will look great on others, just not my preference.
review.name: Super cute print!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and coverage, especially for a day in the waves.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is one of the best, if not the best, fitting bottom I've ever owned. Unlike most suits, it does not cut into your curves around the edges. It lays smooth like underwear so you don't have fabricated bulges around your suit. I love the amount of coverage on the rear, it's a little cheeky but not too much. I like the rise but also would love to have this exact bottom with a more traditional mid/low-mid rise.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: My new favorite swim bottoms, thought I would try something different than my other swim bikinis. Flattering, Perfect for the water activities. Ordered Size small.
review.name: Erin reversible bottom

review.reviewBody: I like these bottoms. But the top I bought with them didn’t fit and I didn’t have anything else that would match it so I returned these.
review.name: A miss this time around

review.reviewBody: I bought this bottom in penny/black and I’m really happy with it. I had abdominal surgery last year and was advised to keep my scars out of the sun as I heal, and I was nervous about the high waisted look for myself and had some mixed results elsewhere, but I actually love this bottom! I’m a high waisted convert. Maybe some day I’ll go back to the lower rise, but for now I’m really content with the fit and feel of these. Find me in this bathing suit all year (I live in Hawaii) paired with the Escondido top! Getting in multiple colors because I love it so much.
review.name: Love this bottom

review.reviewBody: It’s the mullet of bathing suit bottoms by being granny in the front and cheeky in the back. Horrible combination.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody: I wanted this bottom to wear around my some what conservative family. This bottom does the trick!
review.name: Good Coverage

review.reviewBody: These bottoms run large. The cut is nice and the quality is great, but I knew they'd be saggy the moment they got wet.
review.name: Run large.

name: Erin Reversible Bikini Bottom - Women's

review.reviewBody:
1. Very breathable
2. Very Light
3. comfortable and nimble
the price is more expensive than non S/Lab version but worth well it the extra premium on top. 
Durability will be tested soon after Winter/Spring here (live at rainy and super cold region)
review.name: Lightest and comfortable trail runners

review.reviewBody: If you liked the fit of the old Sense Pro, you'll probably really like these. Most Salomons are too short in length for me (I typically wear a size 15 US in a Nike), but a size 49 1/3 (or a 14 US) in this shoe fits perfectly. They still have the typical narrow Salomon fit, but their length is slightly longer than their marked size indicates. This model has a lot more cushioning than the old Sense Pro too, which is great for longer days on your feet. It's great to see more companies catering to people with bigger feet, much appreciated.
review.name: Good for big feet

review.reviewBody: Loving the extra foot protection while still retaining a light weight profile.
review.name: New fave Salomon

review.reviewBody: They fit a little tighter than I expected, I think it’s a good thing. Foot doesn’t move in them. Great traction on downhill and uphill, not bad in the mud. They will probably ware fast on the road but they aren’t meant for that. As long as they ware good off road I will keep getting them.
review.name: My first S Labs product

review.reviewBody: I really like the S/Lab genesis shoe for walking, hiking and running. Great support . I am glad they have not changed the structure of the shoe with the updates. I like some color options better than others and this blue and white shoe is not my favorite. Hope to see a new color scheme soon.
review.name: Love the shoe, not the color

review.reviewBody: Was hesitant to spend this much $ on a trail shoe when I have two that I love. This was definitely worth the $!  Amazing fit and zero debris got in despite multiple deep  creek crossings. The traction was fantastic on wet rocks throughout the trail - only the second shoe I’ve found with great traction!  Only complaint is that it seems a bit long, but going down a half size made it too small.  Overall, highly recommend this shoe!
review.name: Perfect trail running shoe

review.reviewBody:
I usually wear S-LAB Ultra shoes. Based on rave reviews I decided to try Genesis. Huge mistake!
When I tried the shoes on, the first thing I noticed was the cushioning which is nice for my plantar fascia. However, when I went for a first run, my plantar fascia started screaming in the first mile. I tried to loosen up the shoes, but it didn’t help. It felt like my feet are in Louboutins (ladies will understand). The sizing was normal, there was plenty of room in the front, but the sides are too snug.
In the end I had to buy a new Ultra 3 shoes again. Now I’m stuck with the Genesis shoes that I wore for a mile and can’t even return.
review.name: Too snug
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: I’m on my third pair of the s/lab genesis. The cushion is superior for pounding the ground for long distance yet fast for the quick turn over. The shoe breathes well, it’s protective from rocks, and dries enough when crossing waist high creeks. My only complaint is the shoe takes a good 100 miles to feel broken-in but the upside is that it will last you a solid 600 miles. The most versatile shoe I own to date as it serves for speed workouts, long distance, climbing, and race day. I’m 5’5, 140 lbs, have narrow feet, and front of the pack. By comparison, a bigger running buddy with wider feet feels the toe box is adequate but still slim in the heel. Lastly, there is no diff. Between the gray and the blue color of these shoes; the white portion is a good spot for kids to draw on it.
review.name: My go-to shoes for 100 milers

review.reviewBody:
Amazing grip and comfort but after 64 miles run the rubber part on toe protector coming off!!? 
Salomon shoes aren’t the same quality like years ago is sad!
review.name: Great grip and comfort bad quality
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I am on my third pair.  Great fit for me right out of the box.  The cushion is good but stillgive me good ground feel.  The shoe drains well after water crossings and stand up to the rough and rocky desert trails I spne most of my time on.  Don't change it!
review.name: My Go To Shoe For Long Trail Runs

name: S/Lab Genesis Shoe

review.reviewBody: This jacket is great when it gets really cold outside at 20°. You're still love it.
review.name: Awesome winter jacket for cold weather

review.reviewBody: Best jacket to layer under a shell. Kept me warm and dry on some nasty days
review.name: Would recommend to anyone

review.reviewBody: This jacket is very warm and well put together. I love the inside pockets very large roomy
review.name: I am thinking of getting a different color.

review.reviewBody: THIS JACKET IS VERY FRAGILE. JUST AFTER TWO WEEKS OF PURCHASING IT THE MATERIAL INSIDE THE JACKET STARTS COMING OUT. DO NOT BUY!
review.name: DO NOT BUY

review.reviewBody: Just opened this up, but haven't tested it yet. I bought it as insurance in the pack for backcountry days. A warm piece of insulation that could double as either a heavy midlayer under a bomber shell, or a lighter belay jacket to throw over my system when necessary. Based on the fit, it's perfect for this purpose. I'm 6'1" and 195; the fit is spot-on for this purpose. I could wear it casually over a T Shirt, but it works equally well over a fleece and shell as a belay jacket. So far, so good.
review.name: First Take

review.reviewBody: Great product which is expected from North Face. I have several non Summit Series jackets and they pale in comparison to this one. A bit more expensive but I feel it's totally worth it. My wife stated that of all the gifts I bought her in our 11 years of marriage, this is the best one. This is high praise since I've bought her an Apple Watch, laptops, clothes, and jewelry in the past. She said this is like wearing a warm and cozy sleeping bag and never wants to take it off. I was skeptical but after testing it out in cold weather and in light rain, I'm am throughly pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone who wants an affordable, comfortable, warm, and high quality product. Great job, North Face!
review.name: Best wedding anniversary gift ever!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my Kilimanjaro expedition and it did not disappoint. In addition to being extremely lightweight, this jacket was so warm. I even had to take it off during some of the steeper portions of the summit push. During our time on the summit this jacket kept me very comfortable as we rotated taking pictures around the sign. I definitely recommend getting this hoodie.
review.name: Warm...Almost TOO Warm!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a Christmas present for my son. But I have a summit series jacket and I love it!
review.name: I would buy it again.

review.reviewBody: Stylish and Warm. I really love the color combination and how fitting the jacket is.
review.name: Best Jacket

review.reviewBody: Great quality, fits true to size, warm in cold weather!
review.name: Definitely buying again!

name: Summit Breithorn Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have to say I have been a costumer for almost a decade, and I was just lucky I never needed assistance. Because this is horrible service. I picked up a pair of these snow shoes in December. Great product with one major flaw, the strap on the bending gets loose. And I guess one day after my hike I put the on my backpack securely and the strap must have fallen, so lost. I contacted customer support to see if I could purchase a strap as I couldn’t find any online. They said they didn’t have any to contact the manufacturer. It’s been 10 days no response.  So now I bought these almost $300 snowshoes, because one review said that they had a bunch of parts so they could be fixed and last forever. After barely two months, I now own a pair of snowshoes I can’t use because of a $20 part I can’t buy. It’s like I will pay for it but no one even wants to sell it. Do not recommend backcountry as they are awful.
review.name: Horrible service

name: Symbioz Hyperflex Elite Snowshoe

review.reviewBody: I love Prana, but the fabric of this Brion pant is shiny, almost glittery. Very disappointed, as I love the fit.
review.name: Love Prana, but....

review.reviewBody: I'm not very rough on my gear, and haven't even climbed or hiked in these pants yet, only worn around the house. After the first wash they started to pill, and after a few washes they have several threads that have pulled up and snapped, leaving very little confidence in these pants for anything active. They're very comfy and fit very well, but after such brief use they look in awful condition which is a shame because the fabric didn't do this in previous versions.
review.name: Great fit, comfy, but falling apart

review.reviewBody:
I had the prior version of both Brions and Straight Zions and both were just a little too baggy in the lower leg for my tastes despite being constantly praised on Reddit as a good do everything pant. Prana fixed that problem with the Brion Slim IIs. There slim from the thigh to the ankle, have good stretch, and feel great on the trail, in the bouldering gym, or just wearing them for casual use. 

If I had a gripe its that the new Zion material is a little shinier, but I can live with that. Clearly...I bought them in 3 colors.

I'm a 32 or 33 waist usually in most pants and usually go for a 34 inseam. I got these in a 32/34 and the fit is fantastic. Like the original Zion material they do stretch a little throughout the wear so they should be snug when you first put them on or you might end up feeling like they are a size too big.
review.name: Finally a true slim pant form Prana!

review.reviewBody: Great fit if you're on the slimmer side, and very comfortable.  The downside is that the nature of this fabric seems to make it very susceptible to snags and string pulls, so not really something you'd want to wear for walking through brush or if you come across a friendly or unfriendly cat.  I was very excited at first and bought two pairs, but I think I will hunt for some trousers made with more robust materials.  I was pretty close stocking up because the cut is perfect for me.
review.name: Been living in these

review.reviewBody:
Brion I is my daily driver pant. I've worn them extensively for the last several years. The only downside to them was that I needed to get them tailored due to the huge, baggy leg openings.

These Brion II pants are everything I wanted from the original Brion.

I recommend sizing up 1 or 2 sizes from what you normally wear. I need a belt with the Brion I in a 30. In Brion II, a 31 is snug but comfortable, and 32 is a little looser but I can still get away without a belt.

It's definitely a modern slim fit overall. The leg openings are tapered and look very similar to my altered Brion I pants. If you don't want a skinny looking fit, these pants aren't for you.

There are no significant differences in material quality. It *might* have a little more shine than the Brion I, but it's only noticeable when I'm looking at them side-by-side. If anything, they look more like jeans to me than Brion I, but that's subjective.

Overall, I highly recommend these pants. They work for me, and I'll be buying more.
review.name: Great upgrade

review.reviewBody: It says "slim" but really they are a "skinny" fit, definitely go a size or two up.  The material is very stretchy, more like a pair of women's leggings.  I was expecting something like Lululemon ABC pants, but these are nothing like that, not near the quality.
review.name: Runs very small prAna Brion Slim Pant II

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my 16 yr old son to wear to school and after only two weeks of class room sitting the back side is balling up and the lower leg of the pant looks worn. Super disappointed in the quality of the pant- and exchange or refund would be awesome!  He has had several other pair of Prana pant and I've never seen anything like this before.
review.name: only two weeks old :(

review.reviewBody: Brion II Pants material is thinner and shiny.  They fit more like tights vs pants.   Not anything like the original Brion Pant which is a great casual pant as well as being cut for comfort so it can be worn in multiple outdoor pursuits.
review.name: Brion II Quality Vs Brion

review.reviewBody:
My brion v1 were the best pants I ever tried. I got rid of all my other pants and only needed my 3 different brion colors. The brion v1 held up great for years, I just can't resist upgrading to the better modern fit of the brion v2.

I only wore just tried on the v2 and noticed the waist felt 1 size smaller than the v1. The slim fit was perfect with the same gusset that helps with flexibility for climbing.

The material on the v2 dark iron felt softer than the v1, but the black v2 wasn't as soft as the dark iron v2. The black v2 was still soft and comfortable though.

I can't comment on the durability but I had no issues with the v1 so I'm sure the v2 will hold up great as well.
review.name: Need 1 size up waist vs brion v1

review.reviewBody: The original straight prAna Brions seemed to be prAna's attempt at a slimmer more modern cut, they were way too wide at the base (I still bought them, and had some taken in). These fixed that issue and they are a tapered modern fit that hits the mark. They can be dressed up, but they still perform well on the trail, on a bike, or on easier climbs. They are also the perfect travel pants. A definite staple in my wardrobe before the update, and now they fixed my biggest gripe with the Brion 2 update!
review.name: Finally, a true modern cut Brion

name: Brion Slim Pant II - Men's

review.reviewBody: Stylish and comfortable. I would love them to provide more support for feet
review.name: Stylish and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Plus Tall Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Delivery was excellent, one day earlier than expected. Boots are very cute and light. Once I tried them in they fit a bit tight however I walked around the house and they did give in. I am a size 8/wide for reference. Comparing the Uggs they are much flexible and light. We will see how they perform in the snow
review.name: So cute !!!

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Plus Tall Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Exactly what i needed. Perfect for narrow feet and a nuce arch support. Lightweight boot. Warm.
review.name: Narrow Fit

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Plus Tall Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots. I had a pair of quilted North Face boots that I loved that finally gave out after years of wear and wanted something similar. I especially did not want the hard, molded toe area that many boots have. These hit all the marks…soft quilted toes and sides, comfy lining, easy to get on and off, warm, waterproof, no-slip treads, and high enough to keep me protected from the moderate snows we get in the northwest. They are really nice looking, too. I also own Sorel fall boots and a winter jacket that I really love. I’ve found this brand to be great quality, with excellent warmth and durability, and very stylish.
review.name: Exactly what I hoped for
