review.reviewBody: Good looking shoes that fit well and that are comfortable.
review.name: Very Comfortable Shoes

review.reviewBody: I have had these shoes for nearly an hour now and they fell great sitting on my lap after driving home! Will buy them again
review.name: Super!

review.reviewBody: Section hiking/backpacking Colorado Trail. Great shows for cushion, water resistance, no blisters
review.name: Yes, best hiking shoes

review.reviewBody: Hoka finally aced it. I was waiting for the wide version. It is fantastic. Comfortable. FYI, it feels larger than 13 size. But it is ok if you are hiking for long distances to manage the swelling of the feet. Goretex is definitely a plus. Height is perfect. The heel area is very comfortable. The only thing I can't evaluate and I have doubts about it is how long will it last. Hopefully my expectation is wrong.
review.name: I would buy these shoes again

review.reviewBody: My travel experience was very comfortable with my new anacapa 2 low gtx perfect for wear. Smooth and soft waking.
review.name: 100% recommended

review.reviewBody: I'm a letter carrier. I need good reliable walking/hiking sneakers. I know people have been raving about Hokas so I took a chance. I've been wearing them for about a month. Despite the waterproof claim, my toes get wet just walking through wet grass, granted I walk through alot of wet grass. I walk 4 to 7 miles a day. Also the material at the ankle dip is already starting to fray. They are indeed very comfortable and light and a pleasure to walk in otherwise and were a perfect fit at first try. Probably would not buy again, need to find some actual waterproof shoes.
review.name: Was hoping for better quality

review.reviewBody: Love the color combination. Difficult shoe to fit my foot. To get the right length)mens 9.5), the shoe feels a little wide in the ball area. While the men's size 9 felt just right in width in the ball area, crested some pressure in the big toe area of the right foot.
review.name: I would it this item again!

review.reviewBody: These are really nice shoes, sturdy, comfortable, all the things you love about Hoka. I really like the olive color. All that said, still deciding if I will keep them or return them due to sizing. I have owned a dozen Hokas over the years. A size 12.5, normal width, has been perfect for all of them until now. As others have noted, this shoe seems a bit larger / looser than others. There is a lot of play in the heel area and it sometimes feels like you will walk right out of them. I suspect that a half size down on this model might be the right answer. I am concerned that on a long hike that the loose feel might be problematic on lgravel, over rocky terrain, etc. I will give them another day or 2 to decide.
review.name: Nice shoe, but looser fit than other Hokas

review.reviewBody: Have only gone on a few hikes so far but they are great.  Light and comfortable.  First time in maybe ever that I have hiked in low top hikers but I really like them, great grip in a rainy hike in New Hampshire’s Whites yesterday. Would definitely recommend them. We got pretty muddy and I haven’t cleaned them off yet. I am a 64 year old with a history of ankle sprains.
review.name: Only a few hikes in…

review.reviewBody: This my favorite pair of shoes so far, I use this shoes for hiking. Very comfortable.
review.name: Best shoes

name: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Shoe- Men's

hasVariant.name: Blitz 35L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Blitz 35L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got this pack for a Barbary Sheep hunt in NM.  Carries my spotting scope and gear with no issues!
review.name: Great day hunt bag

review.reviewBody: I have a lot of mystery ranch packs and I love all of them.  This "frame"/belt setup is great for lighter loads while still being completely bombproof.  I have the Coulee version also which is lighter with less pockets.  The Blitz is great for organization with all the different pockets.
review.name: Great for Organization

review.reviewBody: This is a great day pack. But it could be the best hiking pack if it was 45-50 L, and had a wider waist strap with ticker padding. I do hope MR uses this pack as a template to create a great hiking pack. Most hiking packs are just large bags with zero organization to them. This pack has great storage options for large, medium, and small items.
review.name: Great storage options

review.reviewBody:
‘Blitz’ means lightning and this pack really hits!

Having used my Blitz 35 for weeks on Camino across Portugal and Spain, for weekenders, short trips and ‘heavy’ EDC - it’s brilliant!

Decent size, great accessibility, scalability, comfortable and just really well designed… as to be expected…

A, B, C, pouches work for travel, IFAK and sundries - perfect for travel or distance hiking, water bottle pockets and MOLLE give scalability and the laptop storage, full side access and front stash zone give smart carriage options.

Future harness is proven and reputation deserved.

35ltrs isn’t huge, but works and the MOLLE and strapping gives expansion opportunities; side pouches (MOLLE/FILBE Sustainment Pouches are ideal). 

The belt feels a little redundant for such a small pack, especially for anyone with any height and passing the lower side compression straps under the water bottle pockets would be a great nuance
review.name: Brilliant pack - a true multi role beast

review.reviewBody: Great materials, great design, and most off all extremely comfortable!
review.name: Solid all around bag

review.reviewBody: Really happy with the features this backpack offers. Perfect size and holds a lot of gear for it's volume. I have two of them set up as emergency 72 hour and/or weekend getaway bags.
review.name: Great features and construction

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable l, I would recommend this pack . Great for hikes !
review.name: Plenty of space

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack due the fact that I’m a volunteer Wildland firefighter and I wear mystery ranch gear in that capacity. The only reason I have it 4 not 5 stars is because it doesn’t have molle webbing all down the sides of the pack. This would make it very versatile.As a man on the larger side of things(6’1” 300lbs) mystery ranch is the only pack maker I have found to have packs that fit right for me. I will carry this pack as an EDC/travel/ carryon bag for many years to come. Thank you for making such good products.
review.name: Very good

review.reviewBody:
Nice bag overall. Clearly designed by people who travel and go into the field. I really like the top closure. It allows zipper side access and excess storage. The outer pockets have all the right organization compartments. Belt is extremely small. I followed the measurement guide and got a medium, and the belt is not even remotely close. 

Compression straps on the sides are poorly placed. If you compress the bag then it's hard to retrieve the items in your side bottle pockets. I believe MR already has a model where the belts run inside the bottle pockets. That should be the standard. Or have them right above the opening.

Oh, of note - inside you have two distinct pouches for laptop and hydration bladder. Very smart. Should be standard in 2024.

Overall I still think this is a good bag, but I'm not ready to call it evolution over the 3-day tri-zip line. The military model tri-zip is still the meter stick of backpacks.
review.name: Very clever layout

review.reviewBody: I own two of these bags. One is my everyday business-travel bag. The other is my bug-out bag. With the ABC pocket configuration, I'm able to quickly access resources for both utilities. For work/travel, I can quickly access and store valuables, like headphones, keys, pens, sunglasses, and meds without tearing through the whole pack. For my bugout, I love the elastic straps inside the two front pockets. Great for gauge, tourniquets, and gloves. Mystery Ranch doesn't advertise it, but there is an additional secret pocket behind the two front pockets. There's nothing this pack can't do. Also like that the Blitz 35 can extend upwards (a ton) compared to the fixed design of the Blitz 30.
review.name: Best Overall Bag You Can Own

name: Blitz 35L Backpack

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 1-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This tent performed above and beyond my expectations. I am a 6'2" 270 lb Polish peasant and this tent had more than enough space for me. The generous vestibule handled all of my gear, the head room gave me ample space to sit up and I never felt cramped.
The weather ranged from 35° with 98% humidity (basically, camping in a cloud) to 70° the next afternoon and rain the 2nd night. I was incredibly impressed with how well the tent vented. I had zero issues with condensation. I was also impressed by how well the rain fly held the heat. Unlike others, the wind driven rain never entered the tent (bathtub walls are fairly high) I suspect people didn't utilize the guy lines or perhaps oriented the tent poorly. 
I know it's not necessarily designed to set up and take down the tent inside the rain fly, but by using the ground sheet specifically built for the tent I was able to click it in (lots of patience!) 
I will regularly use this tent as a 3+ season shelter. I imagine its snow load will limit it's use but I look forward to putting it to the test! The Osmo material is true to the pre press - it doesn't shrink with repeated soaking and drying. Love love love this new bit of gear!
review.name: Excellent, Spacious 1 Person Tent

review.reviewBody: I bought the one-person version of this tent and am very impressed. It is super lightweight, but much roomier than my old one-person tent. A major problem with my old tent was that when you rolled up parts of the rain fly to get in/out and let in light, the material sagged and wouldn't stay up. This tent is easy to have fully closed or to be partially open to let in starlight. Very happy with this purchase!
review.name: Light Amazing Tent

review.reviewBody:
This is my second UL tent. My beloved hornet 2p was purchased, after extensive research, for a solonsection hike in  Maine (100 mile wilderness to Caratunk)

I love the tiny footprint of the hornet; weight is negligible, incredibly storm-worthy (once I figured out proper setup and placement) 

After about 6 years, she’s still going strong- minus a few claw marks (I travel with my adventure cat) I really wanted something a bit more spacious. 

I decided on the Dragonfly OSMO and I must say I love the fly fabric. It feels very substantial compared to the original. She’s incredibly spacious with 2 gear lofts at the foot end, two cell phone pockets at the head end, and two headlamp pouches above the head at each side with diffusers. There’s a snap at the very top in the middle of the tent for a lantern or some such ( I snapped my fairy lights into this for extra ambiance in the winter months) The height is excellent. I’m 5’9 and it really feels like a palace compacted to my hornet, height-wise. There are a ton of guy out points, making it incredibly sturdy in high winds, and the vestibule tie outs are great; not quite as intuitive as those in my hornet but once I figured them out, all was well. Because of the stiffer fabric it sheds water and dries MUCH more quickly than my non osmo Hornet, and there was no slimy handfeel after the first rainfall. There’s one spot in the middle of the rainfly that can be used for venting, but I haven’t used that yet, as it’s still quite chilly at night. There’s also a gap in the Velcro there, which I would prefer didn’t exist. I wish the vents were at the top of the rainfly instead. Otherwise love everything about it so far.
review.name: Perfect UL tent for my requirements

review.reviewBody: I've always been a huge nemo fan, almost all my gear is nemo! I recently took this tent on a trip and it was amazing. I love how easy setting up the footprint to the tent is, and I love the pole end clips. They're honestly the best. Super light, plenty durable, and great ventilation. And for someone who is over 6 feet tall, I didn't feel cramped, which was huge for me. Honestly, I'm just obsessed.
review.name: I'm obsessed

review.reviewBody: Nice and small and light while still having tons of features. Solid construction.
review.name: Awesome tent!

review.reviewBody: Perfect solo hunting tent (hiking, etc.)  Packs down small, lightweight, easy to set up, and withstands the elements. The price is fair and a great company that cares.
review.name: Solo Hunter - Best Tent

review.reviewBody: Okay a 3lb fully free standing tent.   The OSMO rainfly is a cool blend of fabrics and doesn't sag in the rain.  Lots of pockets.   Only downside is lots of stakes needed to fully stake the tent out.
review.name: This tent is rad

review.reviewBody: Great little tent, got the 2p for solo camping and had plenty of space for all my gear for mild winter camping. Taking the tent poles out of the stuff sack really compresses down the tent making it super easy to transport! Great product, highly recommend!
review.name: Awesome tent

review.reviewBody: I've used this tent on backpacking and canoeing trips.  It's so light and small that I was asked, that's your tent?  Ton's of room in the two person.  Easy and fast to set up. Tons of cool features.  I really like the pockets in the top.  As I get my sleep system set up, I put all my tent bags and other stuff sacks up there, out of the way and not lost in a corner.  This tent is great.
review.name: Excellent tent

review.reviewBody: This Bike Packing Tent works great on motorised bikes as well. Keeping your luggage compact and light is essential for getting into the backcountry. This great tent with its short tent poles fits perfectly in my luggage system and still offers all the comfort I expect from a tent. The double entree, awesome ventilation and plenty of room inside the tent make this my go to tent for all my motorcycle adventures. The green color works well for stealth camping. I'm 6ft 3" and I have plenty of room in this tent with its almost vertical wall. Features like the light pocket and the glove drying line make it even better. The only thing I would improve, and that is me really looking for something, is the phone pocket. If I could see the time on my Iphone when I tap it that would make it perfect. There is a seam right in front of it right now. Keep up the great work Nemo!
review.name: Perfect tent for Moto Camping

name: Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 1-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: I bought a small pair 3 months ago, then went back to buy two more medium pairs because I like them so much but wanted a slightly looser fit.
review.name: Love these gloves

review.reviewBody:
Completely died after 10  rides (about 600 miles total). Washed them 3 times. They lose color and parts every time I handwash them. But they are super comfortable and it makes me even more angry. 
Won't provide sizing suggestions. Please read the reviews and don't buy this model.
review.name: Bad quality.

review.reviewBody: I had ordered the "screaming red" gloves because the image despite the name of the color, shows them as being orange in color. Well, they are not! They are indeed red. So if you are looking for orange gloves, don't order them.
review.name: Color on product image is wrong

review.reviewBody: I used the sizing chart to make sure I ordered the correct size.  I fit into the medium size group with plenty of extra room making sure I measured around the widest part of my hand with the tape measures pretty loose; however, when I received the medium gloves they looked like they were made for a child.  I couldn't get them close to even going onto my hand.  The wrist section with the strap fully released was so tiny.  I have pretty normal sized hands so I'm not sure why these run so small.
review.name: Size chart is way off

review.reviewBody: I ordered pink ones. Not that i love pink color, but just to increase visibility and stand out more to drivers.  Gloves fit great,  padding is good,  not too much,  not too little.  Nice, snug, perfect.  Took one star off because for first few months i would have pink hands after rides. The color  would bleed and bleed until they have faded out enough that there's not much left. They are faint pink at this point,  i still love them and wear them often. Quality is great,  I've put thousands of miles on them. No rips, no tears.
review.name: Great gloves

name: ELITE Gel Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: I mean it does its job but if you put it in a bag and it gets folded at all it stays looking weird and folded
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody: Love the weight, size and color of this hat. It also has excellent coverage from the sun.
review.name: I want more of these hats

review.reviewBody: it is very hard to find a hat that has excellent coverage.  I finally found the best hat - the Sunbriolet by OR.  I have bought 4 and will buy more because one might get lost.  A wonderful and protective hat.
review.name: a perfect hat

review.reviewBody: Since it doesn’t fold up, I put this terrific sun hat at the bottom of my suitcase, underneath the rest of my clothes. My husband also has this hat, and I got the same size, a large. So, that is a consideration when ordering. It really protects from the sun and isn’t too hot to wear in the heat.
review.name: A great hat for sun protection!

review.reviewBody: I love this hat!  It’s lightweight but sturdy, with good wide brim and an adjustable fit.  And, it looks good!
review.name: The perfect hiking hat!

review.reviewBody: I have 3! I love these hats when I'm going on a long sweaty hike. The sweat drains off the brim. It's great. Also, I look amazing in them. Washing them is a pain and they don't maintain their perfectly flat brim, but it's fine. Wish they would bring new colors. The red is great. The since-discontinued Lavender one goes great with some of their other clothes. Would love a purple one. Great hat.
review.name: Love em. Want new colors!

review.reviewBody: I bought this hat just prior to a 3 week GC river trip to replace the same model I had for years. The regular shipping envelop it came in looked flat, but the brim of the hat inside was completely jacked. It absolutely won't flatten out enough to shade the left side of my face and I ended up using an old straw hat for the entire trip. Ironically, two of our guests purchased the same model in the same color just before the trip and their hats looked fine. Reading thru reviews, this brim issue doesn't seem to be an isolated case. Bummed. OR stuff is generally high quality.
review.name: What happened??

review.reviewBody: Well made, breathes well, and keeps the sun off your face.  Feels light.
review.name: Great sun hat!

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these years ago and really liked it. It had a relatively low crown and The net lining of the crown kept the crown itself from resting on the top of my head. The new hat has a large floppy crown and the lining is the same size as the crown itself. I'm guessing that they change suppliers. It's simply not as well made.
review.name: What happened?

review.reviewBody:
Light weight, quick drying, and excellent sun protection.  Everything I needed and more!
Highly recommend this product.
review.name: Great sun hat!

name: Sunbriolet Sun Hat

review.reviewBody: We ordered two of these, one for my partner and one for me. They adhered easily and firmly to the dashboard of both vehicles, fitting in well with the aesthetics and delivering a quality functional experience. We have loved the easy-of-use and convenience, making it easy to keep track of our phones in the car and keep them charged. Highly recommend this product!
review.name: Solid Grip with 3M Adhesives and Magnet

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the vent mount phone charger and love it! Not a rapid charge, but keeps the phone steady and visible. Bought the non charging for my wife as her holder would let the phones drop. 
These are the best and strongest in my experience.
review.name: The best Mobile phone vent magnet!

review.reviewBody: This has been a great addition to my car for mounting my iPhone. Stick is solid and the minimalist style blends in with my dash.
review.name: Quality minimalist build

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this along with the Nomad case for my 15 Pro Max after seeing it highlighted in a youtube video. I was looking for something to replace the Scoshe magnet mount that I have used for years. I was a little worried that this wouldn't hold up to light off roading, but was immediately impressed at just how strongly this held my phone with the Nomad case on it. It looks great, works perfectly, and was simple to install.

If I could make one suggestion for a future version if it though, I would somehow give it the ability to rotate "arm" and lock it into any position. Or even maybe be able to swap the arm out for other arms of different lengths/angles. To me that would greatly increase the mounting options. For my 2018 Tacoma the only logical place to mount this was just to the left of the hazard light, and thankfully it worked perfectly there the way it is.
review.name: Excellent Product! Works Perfectly!

review.reviewBody: This is easy to fit, with just a small bit of flat surface and very simple to use.  as it is magnetic, you can almost throw the phone at it and it sticks and with a car cable/adapter, charges while connected.  Nifty!
review.name: Simple and efficient!

review.reviewBody: Looked far and wide for a product just like this, glad to have found it!
review.name: Good Quality!

review.reviewBody: I think this is probably an issue of sunlight on a dash and the heat generated by wireless charging but on a summer day, my phone doesn't get more than a handful of percent after sitting on this for an hour drive. I think the phone/charger limit the charging because of the heat. Super clean design, the wire clips aren't very permanent, solid.
review.name: Not great at charging

review.reviewBody: I have the Qi2 and it always overheats so much that the iphone stops working, the car mount burns with heat and also has no heat dissipation design so the iphone system slows down so much that it stops working temporarily until it cools down by taking it out of there, and I have done many car trips and using the GPS google maps (offline maps) and it is always the same.
review.name: TOTAL OVERHEATING

review.reviewBody: I have been using my car mount for over 6 months and I have no complaints with it. My phone attaches super easily to the mount and I don’t have to worry about it falling off. The adhesive that attaches the mount to the car is super strong, it holds up well even in the extreme heat. I would definitely recommend this mount.
review.name: Simple and secure

review.reviewBody: Small and sleek design so it doesn’t look bulky or awkward on the dash. Great holding power. It detaching easily.
review.name: Sleek Fit

name: Charging Car Mount

The fit is so flattering! It's got a feminine cut so I'm not swimming like in a traditionally cut tee. I got XS, which is what I usually wear in tees. I'm almost flat chested in a sports bra. I've owned it for at least a couple years now and the size, shape is virtually the same since new. During that time I've worn it countless times whenever the weather permits. The fabric is med weight and comfortable. 
The only thing I dislike is that it has faded. I got the blackberry color. I wash cold on delicate cycle, dry on delicate/low heat. It is cotton though and it's well-loved so I guess it makes sense it's faded. It doesn't wrinkle if you take it out right away.
review.name: Love it!

description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Trekker Pillowcase online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trekker Pillowcase
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Trekker Pillowcase online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For both home and travel, I use a "Tempurpedic NeckPillow - Travel" and this pillowcase fits that so perfectly, it's as if it's made for it. Previously, I had been using normal pillowcases for this very small pillow and it was awkward. This is just perfect.
review.name: Great for Tempurpedic Travel NeckPillow

review.reviewBody: Just a regular small pillow case. Smaller than I imagined it would be. Maybe I didn't pay close enough attention when buying it online to the size. I stuffed it with clothes and they ended up falling out during most nights. No drawstring or much to keep something stuffed in there. I guess its fine for what it is but it fell short of my expectations for outdoor design.
review.name: Just a regular small pillow

review.reviewBody: I stuff this with my puffy or the thermarest hooded poncho/camp blanket.
review.name: Love this “luxury” item in the backcountry

review.reviewBody: Nice product overall. The top fabric is fine and resilient.
review.name: good stuff to pack your clothes in and have a nice sleep

review.reviewBody: I use these great little pillowcases all summer long for keeping my camp pillow clean. I am leery of putting the pillow in the laundry, so this pillowcase is a great solution for having a clean pillow for every trip. Get 2, they're small.
review.name: Keeps pillows clean

review.reviewBody: I use this pillowcase with the Thermarest inflatable pillow. It is just the right size, soft, dries fast, and has a neutral pattern. I got a couple because I can't always do laundry between trips.
review.name: What's not to like? This pillowcase is great.

name: Trekker Pillowcase

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Mirada Convertible Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I do have pretty wide hips/thick thighs and butt and a narrow waist so I often have the issue of pants being too tight in the hips and gaping at the waist. However, I normally wear a 6 so I got a size 8 and I can barely squeeze them on.  So, if you have narrow hips and a wider waist, these will be great, but for most women I think it would be an odd fit.
review.name: Odd fit

name: Mirada Convertible Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Topeak JoeBlow Dualie Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: JoeBlow Dualie Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak JoeBlow Dualie Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Returned this pump after a very short trial period.  The valve is very hard to engage with the presto valve on the bike tire.  Several times I felt like I was going to break off my valve stem just trying to get it to lock.  On one occasion, we could not even get the valve to engage.  The pumping mechanism is not smooth, and the gauge(s) were not accurate - about 3 lbs off.  Really one dog of a pump.
review.name: Maybe if there is no other option...

name: JoeBlow Dualie Floor Pump

review.reviewBody: The shirt feels good quality and looks just like the picture. The neck isn’t as snug as I’d like nor is the hip part. But it’s okay, I think I’ll be good for the gym for sure.

review.reviewBody: Love the sport length, the material is wicking and I love the slightly longer than average short sleeve, everything about this shirt is perfect for me. It's so hard to find shirts like these

review.reviewBody:
These boots have really fragile boa dials. The ones I had on a previous model got really loose in the housing and made it a pain to do some boa cable repairs. I submitted a warranty claim through boardriders (who own DC) and honest to God it is the worst. They just send you in circles, replying with an automated message, and they never actually get back to you. Super shady company, consider yourself warned. Especially if you shred hard and put your boots through their paces, you'll probably need to invoke the boa warranty or maybe need DC to help you with a repair.. you'll be stuck and out of luck. 
Never buying from them again!
review.name: DC have awful warranty process. Shady!

name: Transcend Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Men's

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. I work in a climate controlled warehouse where it's always cold. Before I bought the jacket I always found myself getting cold chills at. Not anymore. Extremely warm and flexible to keep you comfortable all day long. Thank you Carhartt for standing the test of time.
review.name: Always Dependable

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This was for my Grandson. He was over the moon about it. Looked perfect on him.
review.name: Perfect for north country weather.

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well made, very comfortable and warm! I'm a pretty skinny guy so I was worried about the relaxed fit, but it fits just fine and looks much better on me than the loose fit jackets.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my 20 year old son and he loves it.
review.name: Great quality and fit.

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought it as  Christmas present for my grandson.  He loves it .  Perfect fit !!! Thank you for the quality jacket ( and very warm too )
review.name: Just love my new jacket

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This coat and the last insulated vest I bought have small zippers and hand grabs for zippers 
It's hard for some who works outside to get the coat zipped without taking off gloves every time.  Also big and tall sizes are limited compared to regular size items.  Needs bigger pockets inside coat for phone etc
review.name: Zipper and zipper grab handles too small for cold weather ease of zipping up

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just what I wanted and works great for the Valley weather.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket really warm and comfortable. Looks great. Can be a little restricting to movement.
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just retired my last Carhartt jacket after 20 plus years. this one seems even better and more comfortable then that one did. Anyone who does outside work need this coat or even if you don't and just need a new coat take this one.

review.itemreviewed: OJ392 Washed Duck Sherpa Lined Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Originally ordered a size too big (based off the size calculator quiz results), and returns through the mail were easy and fast. Went down to a size M and it fits like a glove!
review.name: Great experience and coat
